document_title: Hepatitis C: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: viem-gan-c.json_3_Is the hepatitis C virus contagious?
subsection_content:
Sharing needles is one of the main ways the hepatitis C virus spreads
Doctor Thanh said hepatitis C is a highly transmissible disease. Hepatitis C virus is mainly transmitted through blood in the following forms:
Sharing drug paraphernalia: Anything related to injecting drugs, from syringes, needles to tourniquets, can be contaminated with blood and spread hepatitis C. The type of pipe used to smoke or inhale drugs can also be contaminated with blood due to cracked lips or nosebleeds.; Sharing tattoo or piercing equipment: Tattoo and piercing equipment and tattoo ink can spread viruses.; Reuse or use medical equipment and instruments that are not properly sterilized, especially syringes and needles; Blood transfusion without screening for HCV virus; Sharing items that may be contaminated with the patient's blood such as razors, toothbrushes, nail clippers, etc.
The HCV virus can also be transmitted sexually and can be transmitted from mother to child. However, these modes of transmission are less common.
Hepatitis C is not spread through food, water, normal contact such as hugging, kissing and sharing food and drinks with an infected person. (3)
